text:
Une des plus belles vues sur la Rive-Sud car les longues fenêtres qui s'ouvrent par beau temps et donnent sur le Richelieu. Vraiment à quelques mètres des écluses, on voit les bateaux passer. C'est un endroit parfait pour un repas en famille mais aussi en tête à tête. Belle terrasse au 2ème étage pour profiter de l'été! 
La cuisine est raffinée et contient des ingrédients régionaux. C'est une présentation très recherchée et les conseils de la maison sont bien appréciés. Nous avons demandé un vin de la région et ils en avaient un de la région de Farnham mais n'apparaissait pas sur la carte des vins. C'est la seule faiblesse car pas de choix du côté des bières locales en microbrasserie. Toutefois un choix de vin de dessert d'ici. Vaut le détour pour bien terminer une journée d'excursion hors de Montréal!

I try not to award 5-star reviews. I save them for the businesses that truly stand apart. In my opinion, Le Samuel does exactly that. 

My entire family absolutely loved this place. The first night I went with my wife, mom, dad, and two family friends. Our experience was so good we had to go back a second night in a row, this time with my aunt and uncle along. Both times we got a table in the center of the main dining room (ground floor). 

The decor is modern, the lighting warm changing to romantic at about 8:30pm. The view of Saint-Jean's canal and running path is very relaxing. 

The entire staff is friendly and professional, and quite a few are bilingual. It always helps to attempt your French first, of course. For the very best experience, in French or English, ask for Dominique. He is excellent in every respect: friendly, intelligent, thoughtful, and polite. He made every one of us feel like a valued customer. Dominique's service and attitude were a big part of our decision to repeat. He will not disappoint. 

Ask for anything and the staff will present it promptly. Menu questions are no trouble at all. Need a place to set your hat? No problem. You get the idea. 

The food and drink at Le Samuel are out of this world - literally amazing. Everything I ate practically melted in my mouth. You should try the calamari, beet salad, veal cheeks, beef strip-loin, ribs (caution! it's a full rack), and the fresh pasta. Also, save room for dessert, because the toffees are fist-sized lava cakes and there a half-dozen ice creams and sorbets available. 

Prices are very fair for the quality of every part of your dining experience here. This eatery has my highest recommendation. If you eat at only one restaurant in Saint-Jean, make it Le Samuel and ask for Dominique.
Une sommelière qui connaît son métier, faites lui confiance! Excellente cuisine, audacieuse et pleine de saveurs. Bravo.
